  • transformlib.transform module

transformlib package¶

Contains useful abstractions for organizing transformations of data in a modular way.

class transformlib.Input(path: str, root_dir: str = '/tmp/', **load_kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: transformlib.node.Node

load(obj, **load_kwargs) → None[source]¶
class transformlib.Node(path: str, root_dir: str = '/tmp/')[source]¶

Bases: object

A Node in a directed asyclic graph (DAG) of data transformations.

Bases: transformlib.node.Node

save(obj, **save_kwargs)[source]¶
class transformlib.PandasDataFrameInput(path: str, root_dir: str = '/tmp/', **load_kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: transformlib.node.Input

Used for pandas DataFrame Input to a Transform.

load(format='csv', **load_kwargs) → pandas.DataFrame[source]¶
class transformlib.PandasDataFrameOutput(path: str, root_dir: str = '/tmp/', **write_kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: transformlib.node.Output

Used for pandas DataFrame Output of a Transform.

save(df: pandas.DataFrame, format='csv', **write_kwargs) → None[source]¶

Save the ouput of a transform from a fixed path.

Args:
df (pandas.DataFrame): A pandas DataFrame which is to be saved in the

output location.

**write_kwargs: The key value arguments to the DataFrameReader class

in pyspark.sql.

class transformlib.Pipeline(transforms: Optional[List[transformlib.transform.Transform]] = None)[source]¶

Bases: object

A Pipeline is a topologically ordered list of transforms.

add_transforms_from_path(plugin_path: pathlib.Path) → None[source]¶

Find and import all transform from a file.

Args:
plugin_path (Path): A path to a py file with Transform to

be added to the Pipeline.

classmethod discover_transforms(*plugins)[source]¶

Find and import all transforms in plugins.

This function will automatically disover transforms from plugins using namespace packages e.g. fixed namespace(s), as defined by the input plugins args to the function, where plugins are saved.

Args:

*plugins (module): Module(s) that contains transforms.

Returns:

Pipeline: A pipeline of the discovered transforms.

References:

[1] https://packaging.python.org/guides/creating-and-discovering-plugins/

run() → None[source]¶

Used to run all the transforms in the pipeline.

property tasks¶
class transformlib.PySparkDataFrameInput(path: str, root_dir: str = '/tmp/', **load_kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: transformlib.node.Input

Used for PySpark DataFrame Input to a Transform.

load(**load_kwargs) → pyspark.sql.DataFrame[source]¶

Load the input of a transform from a fixed path.

Used to create input to be read.

>>> from powertools import Input
>>> Input('/path/to/input.csv', format='csv')
<class 'powertools.node.Input'>(path=/tmp//path/to/input.csv)
Args:

**read_kwargs: Kwargs to the DataFrameReader class from pyspark.sql.

Returns:

pyspark.sql.DataFrame: The DataFrame that the input is pointing to.

class transformlib.PySparkDataFrameOutput(path: str, root_dir: str = '/tmp/', **write_kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: transformlib.node.Output

Used for PySpark DataFrame Output of a Transform.

save(df: pyspark.sql.DataFrame, **write_kwargs) → None[source]¶

Save the ouput of a transform from a fixed path.

The default save mode is set to ‘overwrite’ because this is most commonly used.

>>> from powertools import Output
>>> Output('/path/to/output.csv', format='csv')
<class 'powertools.node.Output'>(path=/tmp//path/to/output.csv)
Args:
df (pyspark.sql.DataFrame): A DataFrame which is to be saved in the output

location.

**write_kwargs: The key value arguments to the DataFrameReader class

in pyspark.sql.

class transformlib.Transform(output_kwargs, func, input_kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: object

Used to organize transformations of data.

A Transform is a many to many mapping between Input and Output nodes. When run the Input nodes are loaded and the calculated outputs from the function is written to the Output nodes.

property inputs¶

A tuple with all the Inputs of the Transform.

property nodes¶

A tuple with all the Nodes of the Transform e.g. Input and Output.

property outputs¶

A tuple with all the Outputs of the Transform.

run() → None[source]¶

Runs a transform.

transformlib.transform(**kwargs: transformlib.node.Node)[source]¶

Convert a function to a Transform.

Args:

**kwargs (Dict[str, Node]): The nodes of the transform.

Returns:

function: A decorator that returns a Transform object.

Find and import all transforms in plugins.

This function will automatically disover transforms from plugins using namespace packages e.g. fixed namespace(s), as defined by the input plugins args to the function, where plugins are saved.

transformlib.transform module¶

Contains the Transform abstraction and helper methods.

class transformlib.transform.Transform(output_kwargs, func, input_kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: object

Used to organize transformations of data.

A Transform is a many to many mapping between Input and Output nodes. When run the Input nodes are loaded and the calculated outputs from the function is written to the Output nodes.

property inputs¶

A tuple with all the Inputs of the Transform.

property nodes¶

A tuple with all the Nodes of the Transform e.g. Input and Output.

property outputs¶

A tuple with all the Outputs of the Transform.

run() → None[source]¶

Runs a transform.
